formattedAddress: 38 E 8th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 38 E 8th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Modern restaurant serving sophisticated Chinese dishes in a spacious, informal dining room.

originalText.text:
used to be favorite place for ordering food for pickup.
when calling back order issue, restaurant hang up on me twice due connection issues, while i can hear them clearly, even people in backgeound, while tried explain food is inedible.

third time calling when try to explain order issue, manager kept interrupting me with lies and wanted to make it my issue and prolonged it as much possible. basicly straight up lie.
threatened me with his shift almost over and would stop assisting me. very very rude, listened only when i rised my voice in order them to hear better. but kept interrupting.
another issue is, when you get there for pickup, they let sit all mobile orders pickups in lobby, whilst the entrance is blocked, if you want check your order. very hard get trough.
was wondering why food get suddenly spicy, without fork or chopsticks put. spicy and very very salty. just give to customer and dont worry about.
never coming back

originalText.text:
Disappointing dining experience. I checked the google reviews and came here specifically to eat the ginger scallion lobster. If there’s a photo published, you would think it’s on the menu. I asked the waiter if we could order, and he said we needed to reserve it in advance.

I decided to still stay and eat, since we trekked all the way here for dinner. Ordered the dumpling soup, egg rolls, chicken wings for starters. Overall sub-par quality and taste was not good.

Moving on to the entree, the double cooked pork and green beans. All the photos may look good, but the flavor was lacking. Tasted like they forgot a few spices per dish or something.

Presentation was all there, clean restaurant, nice tables, good service, the food was even photogenic. However, when it comes to the taste test, failed beyond my expectations.

Don’t recommend coming here if you’re looking for authentic Chinese food.

I decided to still stay and eat, since we trekked all the way here for dinner. Ordered the dumpling soup, egg rolls, chicken wings for starters. Overall sub-par quality and taste was not good.

Moving on to the entree, the double cooked pork and green beans. All the photos may look good, but the flavor was lacking. Tasted like they forgot a few spices per dish or something.

Presentation was all there, clean restaurant, nice tables, good service, the food was even photogenic. However, when it comes to the taste test, failed beyond my expectations.

Don’t recommend coming here if you’re looking for authentic Chinese food.

originalText.text: I love Unkle Ted’s!  All the Chinese cuisine e restaurants have closed in my neighborhood. I saw this place when walking home one day and I stopped in. Lol. I always gets generals chicken which comes with broccoli florets  and white rice and I ordered a small wonton soup.  $25.04. Well worth it. Chicken is fresh and lightly battered with a light coating of sweet n tangy sauce. It is not greasy or heavy.  The portion size is large. I get 2 meals out of 1 portion. ( I already started eating before I took photo below.) The staff is so nice. They used to give the most pretty, sturdy, shopping bag, as shown below. Today, I just got a brown shopping bag; maybe they ran out. They do have a pretty dining area with a bar. Very nice greeting when picking up.

originalText.text: This place is a good standby for Chinese food. Some plates are Americanized, and less tasty, but overall, the food is good and service is excellent. The atmosphere is cozy and modern.

text.text: This place is a good standby for Chinese food. Some plates are Americanized, and less tasty, but overall, the food is good and service is excellent. The atmosphere is cozy and modern.

originalText.text: Uncle Ted's is back! It's so great when a longtime local business recovers from a setback. Their new space is elegant and bright, and the food tastes great. $10-11 lunch special is a great deal for the area with good portions and flavors. Even the wontons in the wonton soup were surprisingly tasty. Looking forward to coming by often.
